intro: Turnera dasytricha var. crinita, commonly known as the curly turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its unique, curling inflorescence and ornamental value make it a popular choice for tropical gardens. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade conditions.
